1.title: Squats
1.desc: Squats are a compound exercise that targets the lower body, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. To perform a squat, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back into a chair. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

1.title: Deadlifts
1.desc: Deadlifts are a compound exercise that targets multiple muscle groups, including the hamstrings, glutes, lower back, and upper back. To perform a deadlift, stand with your feet hip-width apart, toes slightly turned out. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight, and grip the barbell with an overhand grip. Push through your heels and lift the barbell, extending your hips and knees until you are standing upright. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position with control. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

1.title: Bench Press
1.desc: The bench press is a compound exercise that primarily targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

1.title: Pull-Ups
1.desc: Pull-ups are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower yourself back down with control. If you can't do full pull-ups, you can use a resistance band or assisted pull-up machine. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

1.title: Overhead Press
1.desc: The overhead press is a compound exercise that targets the shoulders, triceps, and upper back. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip. Press the barbell overhead, fully extending your arms. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder level with control. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

1.title: Plank
1.desc: The plank is a core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles, lower back, and shoulders. Start in a push-up position, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and hold this position for as long as you can while maintaining proper form. Aim for 4 sets of 30-60 seconds.

2.title: Romanian Deadlifts
2.desc: Romanian deadlifts are a variation of the deadlift that primarily targets the hamstrings and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip. Hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight, and lower the barbell down your thighs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

2.title: Dumbbell Lunges
2.desc: Dumbbell lunges are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee is hovering just above the ground. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position, then repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

2.title: Incline Bench Press
2.desc: The incline bench press is a variation of the bench press that targets the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps. Lie on an incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Lower the barbell to your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

2.title: Lat Pulldowns
2.desc: Lat pulldowns are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your knees under the pads and grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

2.title: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
2.desc: The dumbbell shoulder press is a compound exercise that targets the shoulders, triceps, and upper back. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with an overhand grip. Press the dumbbells overhead, fully extending your arms. Lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder level with control. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

2.title: Russian Twists
2.desc: Russian twists are a core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight, and lift your feet off the ground. Twist your torso to the right, touching the floor with your hands, then twist to the left, touching the floor on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions per side.

3.title: Sumo Deadlifts
3.desc: Sumo deadlifts are a variation of the deadlift that primarily targets the inner thighs, glutes, and lower back. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes turned out at a 45-degree angle. Grip the barbell with a wide overhand grip, hands inside your legs. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight, and lower the barbell down your legs until you feel a stretch in your inner thighs. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

3.title: Step-Ups
3.desc: Step-ups are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand facing a bench or step, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Step up onto the bench with your right foot, driving through your heel. Bring your left foot up to meet your right foot, then step back down with your right foot followed by your left foot. Repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

3.title: Dips
3.desc: Dips are a compound exercise that primarily targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Stand between parallel bars or use a dip machine. Lower your body by bending at the elbows, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body. Push through your palms to lift your body back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

3.title: Seated Cable Rows
3.desc: Seated cable rows are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a cable row machine with your knees slightly bent and feet flat on the footrests. Grip the handles with your palms facing each other. Pull the handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

3.title: Arnold Press
3.desc: The Arnold press is a compound exercise that targets the shoulders, triceps, and upper back. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with your palms facing towards you. Press the dumbbells overhead, rotating your palms to face away from you as you extend your arms. Reverse the motion to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

3.title: Hanging Leg Raises
3.desc: Hanging leg raises are a core exercise that targets the lower abs, hip flexors, and obliques. Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight. Engage your core and lift your legs up towards your chest, then slowly lower them back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions.

4.title: Front Squats
4.desc: Front squats are a variation of the squat that primarily targets the quadriceps, glutes, and core. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your shoulders with your elbows up and palms facing upwards. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back into a chair. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

4.title: Walking Lunges
4.desc: Walking lunges are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee is hovering just above the ground. Push through your right heel to bring your left foot forward into the next lunge. Continue walking forward, alternating legs. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

4.title: Close Grip Bench Press
4.desc: The close grip bench press is a variation of the bench press that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower the barbell to your lower chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

4.title: Bent-Over Rows
4.desc: Bent-over rows are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip. Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight, and lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the floor. Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the barbell back down to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

4.title: Lateral Raises
4.desc: Lateral raises are an isolation exercise that targets the shoulders. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor. Lower your arms back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

4.title: Plank with Leg Lifts
4.desc: The plank with leg lifts is a core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles, lower back, and shoulders. Start in a push-up position, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and lift one leg off the ground, keeping it straight. Hold for a few seconds, then lower the leg back down and repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

5.title: Hack Squats
5.desc: Hack squats are a machine exercise that primarily targets the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings. Stand on the machine platform with your feet shoulder-width apart and your shoulders against the pads. Lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back against the pads. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

5.title: Romanian Split Squats
5.desc: Romanian split squats are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Take a big step forward with your right foot and place your left foot on a bench or step behind you. Lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your front knee in line with your ankle. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

5.title: Close Grip Push-Ups
5.desc: Close grip push-ups are a variation of the push-up that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Start in a push-up position, with your hands close together directly under your chest. Lower your body by bending at the elbows, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push through your palms to lift your body back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

5.title: Wide Grip Lat Pulldowns
5.desc: Wide grip lat pulldowns are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your knees under the pads and grip the bar with your hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

5.title: Dumbbell Bent-Over Reverse Flyes
5.desc: Dumbbell bent-over reverse flyes are an isolation exercise that targets the rear delts, upper back, and shoulders. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight, and let your arms hang down towards the floor. Raise your arms out to the sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

5.title: Russian Twists with Medicine Ball
5.desc: Russian twists with a medicine ball are a core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, holding a medicine ball in front of your chest. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight, and lift your feet off the ground. Twist your torso to the right, touching the medicine ball to the floor on the right side, then twist to the left, touching the medicine ball to the floor on the left side. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions per side.

6.title: Front Squats with Resistance Bands
6.desc: Front squats with resistance bands are a variation of the squat that adds extra resistance to the movement. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your shoulders with your elbows up and palms facing upwards. Loop a resistance band around the barbell and step on the other end of the band with your feet. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back into a chair. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

6.title: Reverse Lunges
6.desc: Reverse lunges are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Take a big step back with your right foot, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. Push through your left heel to return to the starting position, then repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

6.title: Diamond Push-Ups
6.desc: Diamond push-ups are a variation of the push-up that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Start in a push-up position, with your hands close together and your thumbs and index fingers forming a diamond shape under your chest. Lower your body by bending at the elbows, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push through your palms to lift your body back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

6.title: Wide Grip Pull-Ups
6.desc: Wide grip pull-ups are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you, hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower yourself back down with control. If you can't do full pull-ups, you can use a resistance band or assisted pull-up machine. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

6.title: Upright Rows
6.desc: Upright rows are a compound exercise that targets the shoulders, upper back, and biceps. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell up towards your chin, keeping it close to your body. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position with control. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

6.title: Hanging Knee Raises
6.desc: Hanging knee raises are a core exercise that targets the lower abs, hip flexors, and obliques. Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight. Engage your core and lift your knees up towards your chest, then slowly lower them back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions.

7.title: Box Squats
7.desc: Box squats are a variation of the squat that helps improve depth and explosiveness. Set up a box or bench behind you at a height where your thighs are parallel to the ground when seated. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back onto the box. Tap the box with your glutes, then push through your heels to stand back up. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

7.title: Curtsy Lunges
7.desc: Curtsy lunges are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Take a big step back and to the side with your right foot, crossing it behind your left leg. Lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. Push through your left heel to return to the starting position, then repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

7.title: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
7.desc: The incline dumbbell bench press is a variation of the bench press that targets the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps. Lie on an incline bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Lower the dumbbells to your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

7.title: Wide Grip Seated Cable Rows
7.desc: Wide grip seated cable rows are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a cable row machine with your knees slightly bent and feet flat on the footrests. Grip the handles with your palms facing away from you, hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull the handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

7.title: Lateral Raises with Resistance Bands
7.desc: Lateral raises with resistance bands are an isolation exercise that targets the shoulders. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band in each hand. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor. Lower your arms back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

7.title: Plank with Hip Dips
7.desc: The plank with hip dips is a core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Start in a forearm plank position, with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and rotate your hips to the right, lowering them towards the floor, then rotate to the left, lowering them towards the floor on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per side.

8.title: Bulgarian Split Squats
8.desc: Bulgarian split squats are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your back to a bench or step, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Place the top of your left foot on the bench behind you. Lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee is hovering just above the ground. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position, then repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions per leg.

8.title: Jump Squats
8.desc: Jump squats are a plyometric exercise that targets the lower body, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, then explosively jump up as high as you can. Land softly and immediately go into the next repetition. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

8.title: Dumbbell Floor Press
8.desc: The dumbbell floor press is a variation of the bench press that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Press the dumbbells up towards the ceiling, fully extending your arms. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping your elbows on the floor. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

8.title: Wide Grip Pull-Ups with Resistance Bands
8.desc: Wide grip pull-ups with resistance bands are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you, hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Attach a resistance band to the bar and loop it around your knees for assistance. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower yourself back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

8.title: Dumbbell Lateral Raises
8.desc: Dumbbell lateral raises are an isolation exercise that targets the shoulders. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor. Lower your arms back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

8.title: Russian Twists with Medicine Ball and Leg Lifts
8.desc: Russian twists with a medicine ball and leg lifts are a challenging core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, holding a medicine ball in front of your chest. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight, and lift your feet off the ground. Twist your torso to the right, touching the medicine ball to the floor on the right side, then twist to the left, touching the medicine ball to the floor on the left side. At the same time, lift your legs up towards your chest and lower them back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions per side.

9.title: Sumo Squats
9.desc: Sumo squats are a variation of the squat that primarily targets the inner thighs, glutes, and hamstrings. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes turned out at a 45-degree angle. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back into a chair. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

9.title: Jumping Lunges
9.desc: Jumping lunges are a plyometric exercise that targets the lower body, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Start in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back. Lower your body into a lunge, then explosively jump up, switching your legs mid-air so that your left foot is forward and your right foot is back. Land softly and immediately go into the next repetition. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

9.title: Close Grip Dumbbell Press
9.desc: The close grip dumbbell press is a variation of the bench press that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Lower the dumbbells to your lower chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

9.title: Close Grip Lat Pulldowns
9.desc: Close grip lat pulldowns are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your knees under the pads and grip the bar with your hands close together, palms facing towards you. Pull the bar down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

9.title: Front Raises
9.desc: Front raises are an isolation exercise that targets the shoulders. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your thighs. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells in front of you until they are parallel to the floor. Lower the dumbbells back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

9.title: Bicycle Crunches
9.desc: Bicycle crunches are a core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Place your hands behind your head, elbows out to the sides. Lift your shoulder blades off the ground and bring your right elbow towards your left knee, while straightening your right leg. Twist your torso to the other side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee, while straightening your left leg. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions per side.

10.title: Goblet Squats
10.desc: Goblet squats are a variation of the squat that primarily targets the quadriceps, glutes, and core. Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest, elbows pointing down. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out. Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back into a chair. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

10.title: Jumping Squats
10.desc: Jumping squats are a plyometric exercise that targets the lower body, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, then explosively jump up as high as you can. Land softly and immediately go into the next repetition. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

10.title: Skull Crushers
10.desc: Skull crushers are an isolation exercise that targets the triceps. Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a barbell or EZ bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling. Bend at the elbows, lowering the barbell towards your forehead. Extend your arms back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

10.title: Reverse Grip Lat Pulldowns
10.desc: Reverse grip lat pulldowns are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your knees under the pads and grip the bar with your palms facing towards you, hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

10.title: Dumbbell Front Raises
10.desc: Dumbbell front raises are an isolation exercise that targets the shoulders. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your thighs. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells in front of you until they are parallel to the floor. Lower the dumbbells back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

10.title: Plank with Knee to Elbow
10.desc: The plank with knee to elbow is a core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Start in a forearm plank position, with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and lift your right knee towards your right elbow, then return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per side.

11.title: Pistol Squats
11.desc: Pistol squats are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand on your left leg with your right leg extended in front of you. Lower your body by bending at the left knee and hip, keeping your right leg off the ground. Go as low as you can while maintaining proper form, then push through your left heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions per leg.

11.title: Jumping Lunges with Medicine Ball
11.desc: Jumping lunges with a medicine ball are a plyometric exercise that targets the lower body, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Hold a medicine ball in front of your chest. Start in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back. Lower your body into a lunge, then explosively jump up, switching your legs mid-air so that your left foot is forward and your right foot is back. Land softly and immediately go into the next repetition. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions per leg.

11.title: Tricep Dips
11.desc: Tricep dips are a compound exercise that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Sit on the edge of a bench or step with your hands gripping the edge, fingers pointing forward. Walk your feet forward until your hips are off the bench and your knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Lower your body by bending at the elbows, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push through your palms to lift your body back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

11.title: Close Grip Seated Cable Rows
11.desc: Close grip seated cable rows are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Sit at a cable row machine with your knees slightly bent and feet flat on the footrests. Grip the handles with your palms facing each other, hands close together. Pull the handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

11.title: Dumbbell Rear Delt Flyes
11.desc: Dumbbell rear delt flyes are an isolation exercise that targets the rear delts, upper back, and shoulders. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight, and let your arms hang down towards the floor. Raise your arms out to the sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

11.title: Leg Raises
11.desc: Leg raises are a core exercise that targets the lower abs, hip flexors, and obliques. Lie on your back with your legs straight and your arms by your sides. Lift your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them straight, until they are perpendicular to the floor. Slowly lower your legs back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions.

12.title: Barbell Lunges
12.desc: Barbell lunges are a unilateral exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back. Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee is hovering just above the ground. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position, then repeat on the other side. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions per leg.

12.title: Jumping Squats with Medicine Ball
12.desc: Jumping squats with a medicine ball are a plyometric exercise that targets the lower body, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Hold a medicine ball in front of your chest. Lower your body into a squat position, then explosively jump up as high as you can, throwing the medicine ball up towards the ceiling. Catch the medicine ball and immediately go into the next repetition. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

12.title: Close Grip Push-Ups with Resistance Bands
12.desc: Close grip push-ups with resistance bands are a variation of the push-up that targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Start in a push-up position, with your hands close together directly under your chest. Attach a resistance band to your back and loop it around your hands for added resistance. Lower your body by bending at the elbows, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push through your palms to lift your body back up to the starting position. Aim for 4 sets of 8-10 repetitions.

12.title: Wide Grip Pull-Ups with Resistance Bands
12.desc: Wide grip pull-ups with resistance bands are a compound exercise that targets the back, biceps, and shoulders. Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you, hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Attach a resistance band to the bar and loop it around your knees for assistance. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower yourself back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 6-8 repetitions.

12.title: Dumbbell Shrugs
12.desc: Dumbbell shrugs are an isolation exercise that targets the upper traps and shoulders. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping your arms straight, shrug your shoulders up towards your ears. Hold for a second, then lower your shoulders back down. Aim for 4 sets of 10-12 repetitions.

12.title: Russian Twists with Medicine Ball and Leg Raises
12.desc: Russian twists with a medicine ball and leg raises are a challenging core exercise that targets the obliques, abdominals, and lower back. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, holding a medicine ball in front of your chest. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight, and lift your feet off the ground. Twist your torso to the right, touching the medicine ball to the floor on the right side, then twist to the left, touching the medicine ball to the floor on the left side. At the same time, lift your legs up towards your chest and lower them back down with control. Aim for 4 sets of 12-15 repetitions per side.
